Position-3-Description: Please see my most recent published article and letter of introduction https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/medicare-beneficiaries-may-eligible-preventative-cancer-mcfarland/ Who We Are and What We Do Our Mission:  AFFA Advocates work with community partners to fight back against cancer. The United States Government funded research to map the entire human genome in 2003.  This DNA mapping project, at a cost of $5 billion dollars, has critical public health consequences for individuals and society. ‚Ä¢The genome is what all humans have in common at the genetic level, it is your DNA.  ‚Ä¢Mutations in the genome are the cause of hereditary cancers such as breast cancer, prostate or pancreatic and five other forms of cancer. ‚Ä¢When a mutation is detected in the genome there are solutions provided by medical technology to make it far less likely that cancer will ever actually be developed. ‚Ä¢Prediction is the closest thing we currently have to a cure for cancer, it is preventative medicine. It is also a major public health win; the expense of chemotherapy is killing Medicare, due to cost. Preventative medicine is the best hope for preserving Medicare. That is why our government pays for these type of wellness screenings.  AFFA is an organization of Public Health Advocates dedicated to helping Medicare Beneficiaries qualify for Hereditary Cancer Screening at no cost. We seek to work with community partners to facilitate this advocacy. Community partners could include; churches, senior activity centers & other public or private organizations. We provide a no-cost educational presentation in a group setting for our community partners.  Please join with us in this advocacy campaign by talking to an AFFA Advocate about doing a Hereditary Cancer Screening education presentation in your facility today. Contact: CEO@ZeroLimitGroup.com To Join My Team Click Here: https://advocate.affa.life/backoffice/2482eaad4/signup Also email: SmartMoneyChris@gmail.com for sign-up instructions.

Position-1-Description: Author Artificial Intelligence for Wireless Networking.  In this book, I begin with an introduction to the subfields of AI and gradually connect the dots between various subfields, to establish an intelligent Wi-Fi and/or 5G network.  Artificial Intelligence for Wireless Networking' includes sections on: * Fundamentals of AI * User Experience Intelligence * Automated Wireless Network Operation * Active Security Protection * Implementing AI in your Network Although no one can predict what the future might hold, AI is blurring the lines between science fiction and scientific reality.  This book delves into the possibilities of using brain-waves to fine tune the Wi-Fi/5G performance to user's psychological expectations.  The examples in this book will leave your grey cells tickled, building your ability to think the AI-way! Often, AI is viewed as a potential threat to human jobs. To tackle this uncomfortable zone, I also address possible collaboration options with various AI Systems and the skills that will keep you relevant and in demand.  This book will inspire, educate, and challenge you to use artificial intelligence not just for wireless networks but well beyond. This book is useful for anyone who wants to learn about AI or is looking to solve problems in the field of wireless networking.  Network administrators,  Wi-Fi/5G Product Developers, Service Providers,  Networking students, AI researchers, and innovators will find this book useful in their respective areas of interest.
Position-2-Description: Author of Book RTLS For Dummies. Published by Wiley Publishing, Inc.  This book gives you the whole RTLS story, from soup to nuts, in the easy to understand For Dummies format. I begin with a tour of the RTLS applications and then serve you the details of what goes into an RTLS and what the various RTLS technologies are. Then, I plunge into the practical things that you need to consider before installing an RTLS and the common pitfalls that you need to be aware of. I include a chapter on evaluating an RTLS solution or selecting an RTLS vendor. And because RTLS security is equally as important as its accuracy, I also include a chapter on possible RTLS hacks and attacks. After reading this book, you‚Äôll know what an RTLS is, how an RTLS is achieved, how to choose the right RTLS technology, and how you can make an RTLS work for you. Like other For Dummies books, this one‚Äôs been designed to let you skip around as much as possible. If you don‚Äôt want to read this book cover to cover, you don‚Äôt have to. Your current knowledge or experience of an RTLS makes some topics more relevant than others. If you want to zero-in on a particular topic, you can use the Table of Contents and index to focus on that coverage.

Summary: ‚ùùAbility is what you're capable of doing. Motivation determines what you do. Attitude determines how well you do it.‚ùû - Lou Holtz I feel that this quote defines my leadership style and approach to every opportunity. I am an executive who excels at leading organizations to make customers the #1 focus of their operations, leading to double digit growth, higher customer retention, and increased share of wallet.  I gravitate toward disruptive and emerging strategies, products, and services geared towards enhanced convenience and improved customer experience. I am also strategic, always looking for what's next to facilitate stronger business results and profitable growth. Leaders should be accountable for outcomes. Empowerment with accountability drives focus, minimizes distractions, and provides line of sight to priorities and expectations. When it comes to solving problems, I am a firm believer in addressing the root cause, rather than treating symptoms. This builds a foundation for future success and unearths new business opportunities.  My skills and interests can be successfully applied to leadership roles in: ‚Ä£ Customer Experience, Lifecycle, Loyalty, and Retention ‚Ä£ Business Unit Management, Revenue Growth, and Business Development ‚Ä£ Operational Excellence and Strategic Program Management A few of my core beliefs and values include: ‚òÖKeep the Focus on the Customer‚òÖ Customer interactions and relationships are opportunities to enhance satisfaction, build loyalty, maximize revenue, and can often serve as springboards to launch new growth initiatives. ‚òÖRelentlessly Innovate and Embrace Change‚òÖ Business breakthroughs and enhancements to customer experience come from listening and experimenting with new options, iterating improvements rapidly, and influencing the organization to embrace agility and flexibility. ‚òÖApproach Problem Solving Strategically‚òÖ  Effective leaders have the vision to create a strategic direction combined with the ability to understand intuitively what needs to be done operationally. Question, analyze, and understand business dynamics quickly to arrive at an effective plan to drive results. ‚òÖCommunicate and Collaborate‚òÖ  It is critical that leaders build strong partnerships with customers, vendors, business partners, and other stakeholders. This allows them to build productive cross-functional teams, recognizing that each part of the organization has a part to play in the customer experience.

Summary: Results-oriented, trusted, entrepreneurial, and high-energy marketing and communications executive with diverse industry experience in sports, higher education, financial and legal services. Demonstrated history of launching successful new initiatives. _______________________________________ Sara oversees Wells Fargo's soccer portfolio including Major League Soccer, the Mexican National Team, team sponsorships as well as ESPN's annual espnW Women+Sports Summit. Her sports business background also includes: Business Development for the Boston Blazers (a startup lacrosse team), Hispanic Partnerships for Major League Soccer, and Labor Relations for Major League Baseball. Sports Business Journal named Sara to the 2018 class of Game Changers: Women in Sports Business. Before joining Wells Fargo, Sara worked at Allied Minds directing the company's marketing efforts and scouting investment opportunities. She also served as an Associate Director of Alumni Relations for the University of Chicago covering the New England and Mid-Atlantic regions. She started her career at the law firm of Covington & Burling in Washington, DC first as a legal assistant and later in public relations & marketing. Raised on the South Side of Chicago, Sara earned her BA in Public Policy from the University of Chicago and an MBA from the NYU Stern School of Business. Sara currently serves on the boards of the University of Chicago and Play Like a Girl!; as an advisor to the Harn Museum of Art; and volunteers as a Guardian ad litem for the State of Florida and for the Michael Mosier Defeat DIPG Foundation. Summary: I am the head of the Relationship Analytics and Engineering Department at Goldman Sachs. We are building the ‚Äò‚ÄòGoldman Sachs Knowledge Graph‚Äù. Towards this end, we combine multiple sources of structured (e.g., trades, transactions) and unstructured (e.g., text, voice) data into a single, highly heterogeneous, knowledge graph with hundreds of millions of nodes and billions of edges - our mission is to capture all the firm relationships related to communication, trading, as well as money transfers. From an algorithms perspective, the team develops scalable solutions (Hadoop, MapReduce, HDFS, HBase) for several graph mining problems such as vertex centrality (e.g., pagerank), vertex similarity, (shortest) paths, vertex deduplication, community detection, and graph embeddings, to name a few. From an applications point of view, our work is used 1) within the Compliance Division, to enable the development of regulatory surveillances such as detection of insider trading and anti money laundering 2) outside of the Compliance Division, in particular, in the ‚ÄúOne Goldman Sachs‚Äù initiative, a cross-divisional client coverage initiative that will develop and implement a more integrated approach to serving the firm‚Äôs clients who interact with multiple divisions, including Securities, Investment Banking, Investment Management, and Merchant Banking.

Summary: I have worked as an advisor since 2005. I combine a goals-based approach to investment with a commitment to the highest levels of service. Through experience and education, I have developed the professional acumen essential to deliver sophisticated advice and planning focused on helping individuals and families to sustain wealth, satisfy goals, create and preserve financial independence and shape a legacy. I appreciate the personal relationships I develop with my clients and enjoy having a positive impact in their lives. Whether identifying an appropriate investment plan, assisting in selling a business or meeting with their estate attorney, it is my goal to be an essential part of each client's financial life. With my team, we have developed and refined a wealth management process to help address client's problems with thoughtful advice and guidance. During discovery meetings, we get to know each client and what matters most to them. We run projections to see if the client is on track to meet their goals and to create a roadmap to guide our strategies. Client data and projections are used to implement strategies that are appropriate for each client's unique situation. We regularly verify that client investments are working toward their goals. Our goals-based wealth management process evolves as client situations change. I graduated from Duke University. In 2008, I earned the CERTIFIED FINANCIAL PLANNER‚Ñ¢ certification and in 2019, I earned the Certified Private Wealth Advisor¬Æ certification, administered by the Investment and Wealth Institute and taught in conjunction with The Yale School of Management. I am the President of The Board of Directors of the New Mexico Estate Planning Council and on the Board of Trustees for Manzano Day School.  I am happily married and have 2 wonderful children. In my free time, I enjoy playing golf with my daughter or soccer, basketball and lacrosse with my son. When trying to relax, you can catch me watching Duke Athletics.

Summary: We are living through a period of unprecedented social unrest. This is the time for leaders to understand that they can no longer be focused merely on results, we must be the champions of positive societal change. That will mean uncomfortable conversations, leading with integrity and embracing real inclusion while still being our authentic and true selves. Not an easy ask but one that I am committed to striving towards  every single day. I spent 5 years client side working at T-Mobile, Vodafone and L'Oreal, where I was responsible for accelerating marketing effectiveness, leading integrated digital marketing strategies, creating multi-channel platforms and media partnerships that spurred revenue growth fostering a culture of accountability.   As EVP, Business Development for Havas Media Group, contributed to the agency winning back to back 'Agency of the Year' for both ADWEEK and MediaPost. Nominated by the CMO Club in 2013 as 'CMO of the Year' for Cardinal Path in the Marketing Innovations category and named as one of 'The Women Driving Chicago's Digital Renaissance' by Built in Chicago. Named to Internationalist Magazine‚Äôs Agency Innovator list in 2009 and led Spark Communications to win MediaPost Magazine's 2009 Boutique Agency of the Year award. Graduated from Northwestern University with a BA in History and an MBA in marketing and international business from Loyola University of Chicago. In 2018 we launched Motive, providing marketing, strategy and media consultancy for progressive candidates, causes, philanthropies and socially conscious enterprises. With the integrated agency offering Motive, we bring world class expertise to the political arena to effect positive change. Our Adopt-A-Candidate program supports first time female political candidates running for political office. We helped elect Democrats in the mid terms and are working hard in the 2020 cycle to repeat our success up and down the slate. Specialties: marketing strategy, media, marketing alliance development, telecommunications, mobile, digital, search, eCRM, analytics, econometrics, financial model design, social marketing, advertising.

Summary: Bradley J. Schaufenbuel is currently Vice President and Chief Information Security Officer at Paychex.  Prior to his current role, he held security leadership positions at Paylocity, Midland States Bank, Midwest Bank, Zurich Financial Services, Experian, and Arthur Andersen LLP.  Bradley is the author of multiple books (including two 'For Dummies' titles) and has had numerous articles published in professional journals on a wide variety of topics related to information security and governance.  He is licensed to practice law in Illinois and is a member of the United States Supreme Court Bar.  Bradley holds twenty-five professional designations in the areas of information security management, IT compliance, information privacy, fraud examination, IT audit, computer forensics, ethical hacking, business continuity planning, project management, cloud security, and process improvement, including the C|CISO, CISSP, CISM, CISA, CCSP, CIPP/US, CIPP/E, CIPM, CSSLP, PMP, CRISC, CGEIT, ISSMP, ISSAP, CFE, C|EH, CBCP, CCSK, CDPSE, DFCP, CIFI, CSOXM, CSOE, ITIL v3 Foundation, and Six Sigma Black Belt.  He holds an MBA from DePaul University's Kellstadt Graduate School of Business and a JD and an LLM in information technology and privacy law from the University of Illinois at Chicago's John Marshall Law School.  Bradley has served as a director on several corporate and non-profit boards, is a regular speaker at industry conferences, and has served numerous clients in the legal, financial services, and healthcare industries as a freelance consultant.  He is an advisor to YL Ventures GP, Ltd., Glilot Capital, Eclipz, Inc., Great North Labs, EventCombo, CloudVector, and ThirdPartyTrust.  Bradley was recognized as the Chicago CISO of the Year in 2018 and as one of the Top 100 CISOs for 2020 by Cyber Defense Magazine.

Position-1-Title: Director of Data Science and Analytics
Position-2-Description: Dr. Anyouzoa has developed a data analysis framework that combines Random Matrix Theory / Spectral Analysis and Evolutionary Dynamics to make it possible to structurally and behaviorally study the dynamics of Starbucks sales data and 'par ricochet' the evolution of customers‚Äô preferences. Beyond Evolutionary Dynamics, the contribution of Stoichiometric Network Analysis and Metabolic Flux Mode Analysis makes it possible to leverage mature techniques from Hypergraph Theory to investigate and track the temporal socio-dynamics in Starbuck customers population (preferences, tastes, demography, etc.) before changes negatively impact sales data, giving Starbucks enough lead-time to take corrective measures. Boltzmann statistics is used to inform stores' replenishment for improve supply chain.
Position-3-Description: Dr. Anyouzoa has designed and implemented in collaboration with Microsoft, a Configuration Driven Machine Learning CI/CD framework called AI-Reserve. AI-Reserve is a managed AI frameworks (Facebook‚Äôs PyTorch, Google‚Äôs TensorFlow, etc. ) agnostic CI/CD platform. It  was created with one goal in mind: help Starbucks operationalize models faster and more securely with CI/CD on Azure and deliver more business value faster. AI-Reserve extends Git workflows and creates a continuous delivery pipeline using AzureML and automatically triggers build, test and deployment processes. AI-Reserve is backed by a powerful 'Experiment Engine,' a library that lets users define their machine learning workflow once, and execute it many times in a parameterized, portable fashion.  The Experiment Engine supports workflows such as training and deploying of models, performing model selection over a range of models and parameters, and fanning out model deployment to several endpoints. The Experiment Engine uses Azure Machine Learning service on the back-end for tracking experiments, registering models, performing vulnerability analysis, and creating web service deployments. Training is supported for local Python scripts, remote Python scripts on AzureML compute cluster, and DBC Notebooks on Azure Databricks cluster. Models are deployed as Docker containers, using base images one can customize. Supported deployment targets include Azure Container Instances and Azure Kubernetes Service. Machine learning workflows are captured in configuration JSON files in which one defines compute resources, training runs and their parameters, models and their metrics, and web service deployments. Configuration JSON files are translated into scaffolding Python scripts that glues together the blocks of execution, such as resource allocation, model selection, and model deployment. The resulting structure is run/executed and orchestrated under the control of the Experiment Engine to users‚Äô specifications.
Position-4-Title: Data Science Group Manager for Healthcare Analytics - GHS (Government Healthcare Solutions)
Position-4-Description: Conduent (NYSE: CNDT) issued an IPO on January 3, 2017 as a spin-off of Xerox HRS from Xerox Corporation (NYSE: XRX). At Conduent, my team designs and develops next generation Healthcare Analytics solutions for the healthcare market in cooperation with Xerox PARC. We are disrupting customer care through analytics and automation. Predictive analytics, prescriptive analytics, and machine learning are bread and butter. We are building a data science team that will provide the kind of customer engagement that will delight the customers, leveraging key insights that we understand about them. Enable the customer with a set of things that would make them be more productive. An engagement that would take place, not only in times of failure. A complete cycle whereby our Customer Support informs the customer by any practical mean of ways to render their experience with the products we cover more enjoyable. Dr. Anyouzoa has designed and implemented, as part of the Xerox 'Health Care Analysis Platform' an automated statistical analysis tool called 'Onion Peeler' that organizes variables in concentric layers made up of variables with similar statistical leverages. The 'Onion Peeler' creates a noise-reduced environment where various analysis techniques generate more accurate and relevant analytical insights.
Position-5-Description: Dr. Anyouzoa is the lead Data Scientist in a company wide effort to build an Analysis Framework fed by multiple event based systems. He designed the framework and is actively involved in its implementation. The main requirements were to build a system that will be up 24/7, permit seamless extension, and live maintenance (e.g.: the framework should never be brought down for patches). This framework lets individuals across the company add new functionalities to it through the implementation of extensible interfaces (custom analyzers) and dynamic linking. The results of the custom analyzers are routed to the scoring engine mentioned below for advanced statistical analysis. This framework provides engineers with tools to measure the confidence and reliability in data. It is a surface that bridges the gap between the raw data Microsoft collects from billions of machines worldwide and advanced mathematics needed to derive insights from that data. The goal is to enable engineers to leverage advanced and matured mathematics from fields like Information theory, evolutionary dynamics, etc., without having to deal with the complexity of the required science. Dr. Anyouzoa led the analytic effort to close the applications gap between the Android ecosystem and the Windows ecosystem. Dr. Anyouzoa used Homogeneity Analysis (Multiple Correspondence Analysis) and Bayes Inference on Android features and capabilities to craft the fastest and most effective path for Microsoft to close the applications gap in the apps war against Google. Dr. Anyouzoa designed and implemented a video streaming (image) regression analysis tool to monitor the video quality of Android on Windows throughout the development process. This tool was also used in a project to stream Xbox video games from data centers on the west and east coasts.
Position-6-Description: Performance improvement under the Deputy Chief of Staff Office, Dr. Farrokh Alemi
Position-7-Description: Dr. Anyouzoa owns Windows Telemetry Quality. His role is to extract wisdom from data. Skills required combine those of an engineer, statistician, artist and scientist to extract the nuggets of gold hidden under mountains of data, ultimately steering innovation through information. Another part of his role is to teach and encourage others to learn new ways to look at data, and push the envelope to help Microsoft get and keep a competitive edge in data science. Dr. Anyouzoa has developed the Scoring Engine technology to evaluate the quality of the Windows OS. This technology is deployed in Windows Telemetry to monitor data quality in the Windows wide ecosystem. A paper titled: 'Statistical Regression Analysis using Local Dynamics' describing Dr. Anyouzoa's work on the scoring engine has received a 5 stars (out of 5) @ ThinkWeek 2013 under the category 'Open Call' for contributions that are so unique or disruptive that they do not logically fall within a pre-defined topic area. Dr. Anyouzoa was the technical lead in the development of a company wide platform (The ScoringBCM) that provides engineers with tools to measure the confidence and reliability of data. A surface that bridges the gap between the raw data Microsoft collects from billions of machines worldwide, and advanced mathematics needed to derive insights from that data. The ScoringBCM makes it possible to measure fluctuations and reduce uncertainty in data for better analysis and decision making. The goal is to enable engineers to apply advanced and matured mathematics from fields like Information theory, Evolutionary dynamics, etc., without having to deal with raw data. Dr. Anyouzoa extended the scoring engine technology he created with an automatic patterns discovery layer, to analyze large-scale temporal data matrices with billions of entries, using techniques from hyper-spectral imaging. The goal being to detect pre-symptomatic stress in customers' behaviors.
Position-8-Title: Performance Analyst - Performance Program Manager for Windows Sustained Engineering
Position-8-Description: This role is to prevent the Windows Operating System from regressing through Windows updates. Analyzes Windows Scorecards and makes recommendations on to be released monthly windows updates based on the problems found. Sits in the 'War Room' to make sure that recommendations made from scorecards analysis are strictly followed.
Position-9-Description: Dr. Anyouzoa is a Performance Analyst and Engineer working on researching means to enhance the overall responsiveness of the Windows operating systems and Microsoft applications through structured experimental design and analysis using mathematical methods. His responsibilities go as far as to diagnose performance issues in components brought to his attention, and propose fixes that can involve redesigning the component to meet specific performance requirements.  Dr. Anyouzoa is in charge of all the mathematics used in the Scoring Engine, a Performance Analysis System that protects the Windows Operating System from regressing.  This role involves constantly revisiting the maths being used and propose innovative solutions to protect an ever-evolving OS.  Dr. Anyouzoa has designed and implemented an entropy-based variability allocation system that, in face of variability in systems (machines, code-flows) response, would detect the source of variability in the data stream (machines, code-flow, combination machine\code-flow or other factors). This is a powerful tool used to go after regressions in the windows based systems and scenarios. Dr. Anyouzoa has designed and implemented a scoring engine to guard the Windows OS against regressions, using Tensors Physics and techniques from Neuroscience. The scoring engine is at the heart of monitoring code flow to prevent code churn from regressing the Windows OS, ultimately preventing such regressions to land into a customers‚Äô computers. A key pillar for shipping cleaner and faster Windows Operating Systems. Dr. Anyouzoa has designed and implemented a C++ based test framework that is being used to progressively phase out the current Jscript based test framework utilized to test Windows servers. Dr. Anyouzoa has designed and implemented a Memory Analysis Tool based on Xperf, SQL Server, and SQL Analysis Services to correlate the frequency of appearance of COW (Copy On Write) pages and different kind of page faults.
Position-10-Description: Dr. Anyouzoa is contributing to GITI‚Äôs Intelligent Service Layer and Composable Heterogeneous Agents for Intelligent notification. Dr. Anyouzoa is the Principal Investigator for the Communications-Electronics Research, Development, and Engineering Center sponsored Battle Command Tracking System, an agent based system that tracks the movement of friendly and enemy units in a combat zone. The DBCTS is agent platform agnostic where Cougaar, Jade, EMAA, i-Globe agents‚Ä¶ coexist.  Dr. Anyouzoa is member of the GITI‚Äôs Deep Green Team, a program sponsored by DARPA. Deep Green consists of a variety of software that battlefield commanders can feed information into and get feedback forecasts of how a mission might turn out in return. At the center of the system are two pieces of software: 'Blitzkrieg,' which produces combat models for commanders to consider, and 'Crystal Ball,' which pools a variety of information and offers up the most likely scenarios and the best course of action.

Summary: I help businesses leverage data to make key business decisions. I have applied data science and analytics solutions in insurance, banking, energy and healthcare verticals. I believe scale, accessibility and agility in solution developments are important for making businesses adopt and capitalize on Data Science and Artificial Intelligence.  I code in R, Python, SQL and Linux. I have experience in data engineering and building data pipelines using Hadoop, Cassandra, Kafka, Spark and Scala. I have leveraged AWS, Azure, Google Cloud and on-premise infrastructures for building, deploying and monitoring APIs in real time.  Most of my works involve using parametric and non parametric machine learning algorithms. Linear and Logistic Regressions, K-NN, Decision Trees, SVM and ensembles like Bagging, Boosting, Random Forests are among the common algorithms I use in my work everyday. Blockchain, Artificial Neural Networks (MXNet, Tensorflow and Keras), CHANS, Systems Thinking, Complexity, Behavioral Economics and Political Economy are my active areas of interest and research.

Summary: I enjoy being part of building and working with great teams to solve really difficult problems.  Currently, I‚Äôm part of building a new business for Iron Mountain.  Hyperscalers and cloud providers have finally accelerated the shift to their environments at an extreme rate.  We see Enterprises, Healthcare and Public Sector customers working diligently to evolve their IT infrastructure into hybrid deployments and exit their data centers.  Iron Mountain is uniquely positioned to aid this journey as today we hold exabytes of our customers' data in physical format all of which can migrated to and ingested into the cloud providers.  In the Iron Mountain data center business, we are building out data center campuses with the attention to reliability, safety, security and compliance that our long-term customers expect with the scalability and cost hyperscalers require.  And we are sourcing 100% renewable power.  We are building the team and business now and believe there‚Äôs potential for significant growth.  I don‚Äôt like to accept the status quo.

Economic Forecasts as additional regressors to help calculate potential sales ‚Ä¢	Propensity to Churn (Mobile): Understanding which areas of dissatisfaction lead to the highest probability of churn (deep dive into model portfolio) ‚Ä¢	Price Elasticity (Mobile): Due to the impact of COVID not only has sales been impacted, but taking a deep dive into spend (e.g.  consumers hold onto their phones for longer but spend is unaffected?) ‚Ä¢	Clustering / Segmentation (TV): With a high focus on Premium TV‚Äôs, help create a marketing segmentation  ‚Ä¢	Web Scrape (EoD): Used to help understand ‚Äòpositivity‚Äô / ‚Äònegativity‚Äô over a certain TV series or film. Summary: My name is David Jones and I keep the power on. I am an experienced mission-critical power systems specialist who provides power quality for data centers. If a data center's down because of a storm, we're there to get it back up.   ‚ñ∫ We provide uninterruptible power sources (UPS) so data is never lost. We were there after 9/11. I called the NYSE and  volunteered with my team.  I knew how important it was to show the world that the NYSE was not compromised.  We provided major PM‚Äôs to all their UPS power equipment and ensured operational readiness.  By Monday, the NYSE bell rang as if nothing happened. As a Navy Seal, I know how to handle the high stress and get the job done. ‚ñ∫ We get companies back online. I love helping my clients.  I personally respond to calls.  I get a good grip on the issues quickly then I dispatch my crew to get the job done.  Though there are times when I run out myself, our company is a team and we fix every problem as a team. ‚ñ∫ We are beyond reproach. I believe in honesty and transparency at every level.  I care about my clients.  I want to take care of them.  I give an honest opinion at every step of the way.   I earn my clients' trust. I also help veterans. My wife and I support Special Operations Warrior Foundation, a charity dedicated to veterans and the children of disabled veterans. I also started National Battery Installation as a way to help veterans coming back from overseas.  We train and certify veterans from around the country, providing them with a practical application for their existing skills.  A military vet is used to delivering results.   ‚ñ∫ Failure is never an option.  If you want an honest opinion about the integrity of your backup power or hear more about National Battery Installation and how you could help our veterans, please connect with me!

Position-1-Title: Artificial Intelligence & Architecture for Digital Transformation
Position-1-Description: Businesses today have to be agile and adapt because there are so many things that impact its survival and relevance in the marketplace. These things include advances in technologies (eg. AI, BigData, Cloud Computing, etc.),  nimble competitors (eg. Amazon, AirBnB, etc), new business models (eg. Uber, Netflix, etc.), demanding customers (who expect the same kind of experience from their staid insurance company as they do from Amazon), and the availability of a global workforce (eg. remote workers who can add value from anywhere.). With this many things going on, how can executives and business leaders really understand these holistically so they can make smart decisions? One option is to have some kind of a framework that puts things in context - a framework that is easy to visualize and understand. My role is to help clients create and manage this complexity for better decision making.  Currently in one engagement, I'm working with leaders of the largest insurance company in the US.

In fact, if I include my teaching and research assistantship stipends, I probably made money in the whole deal.  However I realize that today education is much more expensive, and students come out of college with a huge financial burden that many spend years paying off.  While I do have to teach in a college or university for the student to get credit towards a degree, I try to help students acquire some of the business and work skills that'll help them become successful in their professional endeavors.  Today's students will be tomorrow's business leaders.  I love to teach enthusiastic students who want to learn. This is primarily my way of giving back.  So I teach whenever I can, and in this instance, I taught MBA classes in Business and Technology
Position-7-Description: Here's one of the classic problems large organizations and governments have. They have many different departments or functional areas, and the department heads have the power and influence to buy tools that are appropriate for their own work. Little if any, consideration is given to the overall objective of the organization. As a result, many of the big organizations end up with a plethora of tools and processes. In this particular case, I worked with the Texas Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) to help integrate their over 1200 different tools. This role required business smarts to navigate the politics perspectives, and egos, and also required technical acumen to understand the functionality of different systems, and how they eventually have to work together to deliver value to the citizens of the State of Texas.  Once that's understood, I worked with many teams to architect the future state of the HHS make presentations to executives who had the charge and obligation to make effective and strategic decisions, based on my models and recommendations. Obviously, there was a lot to do and in  one year I could not integrate the whole organization, but made very good progress.
Position-8-Description: Again, teaching students at any opportunity I can get. Keeps me on my toes as well and forever young! In this case, I taught MBA class on Operations Management.
Position-9-Description: Commerce One (CMRC) was really an extension of my Exterprise experience because CMRC acquired us in April 1999. Having developed the platform and software, now was the time to test it out by (1) building applications on top of the platform, and, (2) customizing the deployment to clients.  In this capacity, my team moved from working on the foundations, to developing a Lead-Management application (much similar to SalesForce before it's time).  Simultaneously I was also head of the Processional Services Team whose responsibility was to connect with customers and support the field engineers who were doing installations or support. This experience was also fabulous because it gave me a sense of what the customer needs and constraints were. I often had to make executive decisions on the spot under pressure and the implications of those decisions could mean taking away resources from one area to focus on another.  The direct interaction with customers also helped me understand their positions and perspectives.  This often resulted in changes to the core platform and the applications sitting on top of the platform.  Our customers were worldwide.
Position-10-Description: This was a very exciting time of my professional career.  Here's where I learned and practice the art of designing large scale, robust, distributed, intelligent, flexible software systems for the enterprise.  This was the time the software methodologies and the internet as a tool to be leveraged by businesses was maturing at a rapid pace.  A lot of companies started on a dime - creating application specific software such as lead management, people management, inventory management, product management, etc. Many of these applications had many parts in common - such as a similarly structured database (though the content will be different), similar foundation for user interfaces (though the look and feel could be different), similar mechanisms to run processes (though the process logic is different depending upon the specific process), similar administration needs with security and access control, among others. So our idea (the company founders' really) was to develop a platform on which one could build different applications that could leverage such common functionality.  This was similar to today's application services (like IBM WebSphere), but much more enhanced to include the end-to-end environment within it.  Here I learned many of the architectural principles and techniques that'll come in handy later both in the technical and business context.  I headed a team creative and smart developers, and my team was responsible to provide a customized user interaction for each user each time they access the system. Content relevant to the customer's context at that moment is what we did. This meant that the same customer will likely have different experiences every time they access the system functionality.  None of this could be 'hard coded' because that becomes infeasible to program.   The foundation of such flexibility was in the underlying Agent-based intelligent system.
Position-11-Description: When you go online to configure a car or a computer, there is a system behind the screen that is making some decisions based on the choices you make. For example, if you select a certain body frame, it constraints the engine capacity. Such a system has two parts - a core platform that manages models and specific rules that have to be modeled.  The rules are specific to the domain, and will be different when you configure cars versus configuring computers.  I worked as a consultant, modeling the constraints in the configuration systems behind the UI.  I had to understand the clients domain deep enough so they can be modeled correctly. Once the model is build, then a rules engine takes the customer's inputs as they are configuring the part they are interested in, and prunes the trees to eliminate impossible choices.

Summary: First off, if you would like to connect on LinkedIn, please add a personalized message.  If you are trying to sell me something -- like, I don't know, *data services* as a wildly random example -- you need to say why your business is better than all of your competitors in some important way using an objective, third-party evaluation.   Data Scientist (n.): Person who is better at statistics than any software engineer and better at software engineering than any statistician. ‚Äî Josh Wills (@josh_wills) May 3, 2012 I am a data scientist with particular interest in natural language processing and conversational AI.  My training is both academic and industrial.  I earned a PhD in computer science using ontologies and machine learning to extract information from noisy text, and an MS in CS working on statistical natural language generation.  I have done over a decade of production-level software engineering in several industries.   While I am a data scientist, I prefer to specialize in one area within AI.  I have been doing data science since before the term was coined.  I have been training supervised machine learning models since the late 1990's and designing and developing information extraction algorithm for nearly as long.  What I focus on now is developing search and conversational AI systems (a.k.a. chatbots and Intelligent Virtual Assistants) using knowledge graphs, IE, ML, and AI.  This is the next great frontier for business efficiency and automation.  It will require more than a chat interface to a database to do it right.   Regarding soft skills, I have done some management and would like to do more, though my style is heavy on typing and light on speaking.   If you would like to better understand what data science is, please consider what Justin Megahan has written here:   https://mixpanel.com/blog/2016/03/30/this-is-the-difference-between-statistics-and-data-science/ If you have not yet successfully hired and supported a data scientist but think you might want to, please consider what Talia Borodin has succinctly written here:   https://www.entrepreneur.com/article/310505   Having worked as a data scientist in a wide variety of companies, I agree.

In other words, I used the length of time a user views an item listing page ('view item page') to determine the likelihood the user will make a purchase or do some other positive action in connection with the item viewed.  Explored additional features available in the web logs in connection with the search engine to further refine the analysis.  Discovered and filtered auto-generated events found in the server-side session logs that others had over-looked and that significantly cleaned up the dwell time analysis.  This exploration and analysis will impact a number of projects at eBay that use item click data in search engine result pages as a proxy for user interest.  Analysis was done on eBay's large server-side Web log collection using Java code run in a Hadoop MapReduce framework on a 1K-node cluster. Summary: ‚Äî entrepreneur ¬∑ investor ¬∑ executive ¬∑ data geek ¬∑ privacy thinker ¬∑ former rocket engineer ‚Äî  I'm a business executive, serial entrepreneur, and thinker on data analytics and privacy. I regularly write and speak on these topics at industry conferences, government agencies, and leading academic institutions.  Most recently, I was at Microsoft by acquisition of Metanautix, where I led products and marketing. Metanautix was a big data analytics startup funded by Sequoia Capital and Workday. Position-1-Title: Pandemic Response Group, Global Partnership on AI
Position-1-Description: GPAI is an international and multistakeholder initiative to guide the responsible development and use of AI, grounded in human rights, inclusion, diversity, innovation, and economic growth.  In light of the current international context, the GPAI Task Force invited the working group on responsible AI to form an ad hoc AI and pandemic response subgroup. This subgroup brings together AI practitioners, healthcare experts, members and international organizations to support the responsible development and use of AI-enabled solutions to COVID-19 and other future pandemics. Through its work, it will promote that methods, algorithms, code and validated data are shared rapidly, openly, securely, and in a right and privacy-preserving way, to inform public health responses and help save lives. The subgroup will focus on promoting cross-sectoral and cross-border collaboration in this area and on supporting engagement with the use of AI among the public and healthcare professionals in the global response to pandemics and public health challenges in a responsible manner.
Position-2-Description: The Future Society and Stanford Institute for Human-Centered Artificial Intelligence (HAI), with the support of UNESCO and the Patrick J. McGovern Foundation, have joined forces to create the Collective and Augmented Intelligence Against COVID-19 (CAIAC) alliance. CAIAC will establish an advisory group which aims to welcome experts from international organizations, including UNESCO, UN Global Pulse and other UN entities. CAIAC will structure the rapidly expanding collection of global health, social and economic data on the pandemic to enable the world‚Äôs decision-makers to confidently take action. By turning data into knowledge, CAIAC will help those at the forefront of the fight against COVD-19, including multilateral institutions, policymakers, healthcare leaders, and the scientific community.

Together with the recent launch of the AI Policy Observatory (OECD.AI), the formation of this network of experts is part of the AI pillar of the OECD Going Digital project‚Äôs phase two.
Position-4-Description: STOA is an official organ of the European Parliament, responsible for technology assessment and is active since 1987. Its task is to carry out expert, independent assessments of the impact of new technologies and identify long-term, strategic policy options useful to the Parliament's committees in their policy-making role. STOA's work is carried out in partnership with external experts. These can be research institutes, universities, laboratories, consultancies or individual researchers contracted to help prepare specific projects. STOA increasingly focuses upon round-table expert discussions, conferences and workshops with associated or consequent studies. Members of Parliament (MEPs) and invited experts from EU institutions, international institutions, universities, specialist institutes, academies and other sources of expertise worldwide can jointly participate in the analysis of current issues at these events. The European Parliament defines its position on these issues through reports prepared by its Committees. If Committees decide that it would be helpful to their policy making role to seek out expert, independent assessments of the various scientific or technological options in the policy sectors concerned, they have STOA at their disposal: the Parliament's own Foresight scientific unit.

Summary: Dr. Charlton joined Mercer in 2018 with the acquisition of Pavilion and has been in the financial services industry since 2000.  Dr. Charlton leads Mercer‚Äôs Private Markets Data Analytics & Research team which contributes valuable market research and thought leadership to clients and the industry at large. At Pavilion, Dr. Charlton led the Global Research & Analytics team and took on that role after the acquisition of Altius Associates.   At Altius, Dr. Charlton led the US private equity investment team and was responsible for major client relationships as well as sourcing, due diligencing, negotiating, and closing investments in high quality private equity fund managers.  Prior to joining Altius, Dr. Charlton was a Senior Lecturer in Finance at the University of Texas at Austin, where he was also Associate Director of the Hicks, Muse, Tate and Furst Center for Private Equity Finance. He taught courses in investments, quantitative investments, entrepreneurial finance, and the capstone case course in the MBA program Financial Strategies in Private Equity. Prior to that, Dr. Charlton served as Managing Partner at specialist consultants BH Equity Research in San Jose, CA where he was also the Managing Director & Founder of Context Private Equity Alpha, a fund of funds manager. In 2001 he received tenure as an Associate Professor of Finance at the University of Richmond. Dr. Charlton holds a PhD in Finance from the University of Texas at Austin, an MBA from St. Mary‚Äôs University, and a BS in Electrical Engineering from Texas A&M University. He is a CFA¬Æ charterholder. Prior to this appointment, Dr. Charlton was Managing Partner at specialist consultants BH Equity Research in San Jose, CA. Subsequently he was Managing Director & Founder of Context Private Equity Alpha, a fund-of-funds manager. Dr. Charlton holds a Ph.D. in Finance from the University of Texas at Austin, an MBA from St. Mary‚Äôs University, and a BS in Electrical Engineering from Texas A&M University. Dr. Charlton also holds the Chartered Financial Analyst designation.

Summary: Based in San Francisco, Roger Spitz is the founder of Techistential, the global Foresight, Strategy & Futures Intelligence platform. Roger sits on a number of Advisory Boards of Companies, Venture Capital funds & Academic institutions worldwide. Techistential's renowned Board, Governance & Investor practice works with leaders and their organizations globally to capitalize on disruption as a springboard to drive value. Roger is also Chairman of the Disruptive Futures Institute. He has two decades leading investment banking businesses, advising CEOs, Founders, Boards and Shareholders of companies globally on how to future-proof their business. As the former Head of Technology M&A with BNP Paribas, Roger advised on over 50 transactions across the world with overall deal value of $25bn, and which raised $2bn in capital. He launched the bank‚Äôs US Mergers & Acquisitions practice in San Francisco and spearheaded its European Technology investment banking franchise in London and Paris. With an early career in Venture Capital, Roger remains an ardent supporter of the venture-backed ecosystems both as a deep tech investor and an advisor to several Incubators, Accelerators and VC funds in Silicon Valley. Roger is a contributing writer and member of MIT Technology Review, and a member of the Association of Professional Futurists (APF, Washington), Foresight Institute (San Francisco), Institute for the Future (Palo Alto) and World Futures Studies Federation (Paris). He holds a professional degree in Foresight Strategy from the University of Houston and also studied Complexity Science & Systems Thinking (Santa Fe Institute), Design Thinking & Innovation (Stanford d.school) and Exponential Technologies (Singularity University). Roger is an advisor and speaker on Artificial Intelligence, and has invested in a number of AI startups. He Chairs the Disruptive Futures Institute's Center for Artificial Intelligence, is a professional member of IEEE, of the Association for the Advancement of Artificial Intelligence (AAAI) in Palo Alto, and of The Society for the Study of Artificial Intelligence & Simulation of Behaviour (AISB) in the UK. He also holds a certificate in AI & Business Strategy from MIT Sloan School of Management and Computer Science & Artificial Intelligence Lab (CSAIL). Roger has lived and worked in 10 different cities across 3 continents. Interviews, Media & Speaking:  - Contact: media@disruptivefutures.org. - Disruptive Futures Institute & London Speaker Bureau represent Roger for speaking engagements worldwide.

Summary: Every morning, I go on a three-mile run. As I run, my mind often wanders and I find myself mesmerized in a state crafted by my very own conscience. I think about absolutely everything one can think about and before I know it, end up watching several mental films about my very unpredictable future. Being quite the over-thinker, I‚Äôve recently realized that these visions are nothing more than my mind well... overthinking. Because, for many people, including myself, the future is quite unclear; and for most, this uncertainty is very uncomfortable. However, there does happen to be a very small percentage of people out there for whom this uncertainty is nothing more than a source of motivation ‚Äî a drive to excel and to ensure the likelihood of success, if you will. I am one of those people.  Hi! My name is Wasay Noor; I am an undergraduate at the University of California, Santa Barbara and I hope to be a great fit for you! At UCSB, I am majoring in Economics & Accounting and working towards a minor in Statistical Science, all while completing multiple Finance and Investing courses online. Professionally, I am extremely interested in pursuing Investment Banking and Corporate Finance. Outside of my academic life, I enjoy actively volunteering and giving back to the community, listening to podcasts, and getting in as many weekly miles as possible, as I‚Äôm an avid runner! Ultimately, what differentiates me from most others is not the fact that I have my whole future all figured out. On the contrary, I too, foresee much uncertainty in regards to where my current path will take me. However, despite this, there is one thing that I am more than certain about: that regardless of my destination, my journey will be filled with organization, diligence, prudence, and perfectionism.

Previously he was Return Path‚Äôs Chief Privacy and Security Officer which was acquired by Validity in 2019. Previously to Return Path, he was Eloqua‚Äôs Chief Privacy and Security Officer. Eloqua was acquired by Oracle for $871 Million dollars in 2012 and is now the centerpiece of Oracle's marketing cloud. He was appointed by Department of Homeland Security (DHS) Secretary Nielsen to the Data Privacy and Integrity Advisory Committee (DPIAC) that provides input to DHS on programmatic, policy, operational, administrative and technical issues that relate to personally identifiable information, as well as data integrity and other privacy-related matters. Also appointed as a U.S. Delegate for the U.S. Technical Advisory Group (TAG) within International Organization for Standardization (ISO) and American National Standards Institute (ANSI) supporting work on ISO/PC 317: Consumer protection: privacy by design for consumer goods and services. However, originally SURVIVR began in 2016 as a company called Immosis, which was a virtual reality development agency, serving clients across education, gaming, and healthcare.  SURVIVR was born when the team met a retired law enforcement officer who realized the potential for the use of virtual reality as training for police. In early 2018 the company applied its expertise toward law enforcement training to improve officer safety, officer judgment, and response times in high-risk situations.  SURVIVR is excited to impact public safety positively, and our mission is to ensure that every officer goes home at the end of his or her shift. SURVIVR is the premier training platform to aid in split-second decision making and to practice many of the necessary skills to do their jobs safely and successfully.  SURVIVR is currently being used by several law enforcement agencies, and has a contract with the U.S. Air Force Security Forces to build the most realistic deescalation simulations to date. Additionally, SURVIVR has added three individuals with prior law enforcement experience to the executive team. SURVIVR is proud to be a training platform for law enforcement by members of the law enforcement family.

Position-5-Description: As a Senior Director and a Head of Data Science I have grown New York and Bangalore teams to 15 Data Scientists working across 4 cross-functional teams along with Product, Engineering, Operations and Clinical teams. I am very proud of Medivo Data Science team who has proven over and over again how critical data science is to healthcare and how pivotal it is in improving patients' lives.
Position-6-Description: Founding an analytics team with Medivo was one of the most rewarding experiences in my life. I hired my first employee and started learning the art of people management. With an amazing support from the company I have grown the team to 5 people and groomed top-notch big data analysts who helped other teams understand the lab data and mine ground breaking insights. Our Analytics team explored data on 100M+ patients in 25+ disease areas which contributed to $7M+ in bookings in 2015. We built an interactive visualization tool allowing anyone in the business answer questions on-demand which brought down our average sales cycle by 25%. Finally, we were able to spend time in R&D and started building predictive models that helped with early identification of the patient's diagnosis.

This is when I started playing with millions of patient health records and spotting mind-blowing trends in patient outcomes. I conducted the very first ROI analyses which led to 98% customer retention rate. I also joined forces with Engineering and Product teams to build the very first Medivo Weekly Trigger which turned into a blockbuster product bringing the company over $1M in bookings. I started a new Advanced Analytics & Insights team within Medivo to expand our analytics business.
Position-8-Description: After demonstrating how powerful market research is for product development I was asked to form a new market research department within Medivo. I developed processes that helped collect user feedback on the regular basis and analyzed this data to recommend core features for new products.
Position-9-Description: I was one of the first employees of the company and joined early to help with QA and user experience of the very first Medivo's product - provider dashboard. Position-11-Description: Mentored students in preparation for the US graduate schools, provided guidance in writing personal statements, recommendation letters and helped prepare efficiently for the entrance exams.

Title: Director Data Science at Stanley Black & Decker, Inc.
Position-1-Description: The Data Science team at Burning Glass helps ensure the accuracy of historical labor market data and builds predictive models to help Burning Glass' clients navigate unprecedented economic uncertainty in the labor market.
Position-2-Description: I led a 10 person data science team at Wayfair. We were responsible both for ensuring the accuracy of our product data and for reducing the cost of Wayfair's 3D models. I scaled the team quickly and drove tangible impacts ranging from updating 3.5 million pieces of product data to correcting 1% of all filter options onsite.  I collaborated both with business stakeholders to set the team's priorities and with engineering to scale our models to meet demanding SLAs for real time use in production.  The techniques the team used span a wide spectrum of classic data science techniques including but not limited to: image classification (CNN, Siamese networks, etc.), text classification (deep learning, CRF, etc.), and unsupervised approaches (clustering, etc.).
Position-3-Description: I led a team of 12 researchers who produce both research and products. We employed a wide range of techniques ranging from text analytics to network analysis to classic econometrics.  I was proud to be a founding member of the Webby-award winning effort to create Data USA.
Position-4-Description: I created all aspects of a completely new 12 person R&D team including constructing the operating model, hiring all staff, and designing projects. We conducted research for publication and, where there was strong data, create products both in open source and behind the firewall. Sample projects include measuring the stock of outdated regulations to understanding why open source repositories fail.  Beyond our research, I expanded the team‚Äôs charter to include the creation of market-facing products that I had the pleasure of presenting to private and public sectors leaders (including the White House).
Position-5-Description: During my time directly serving clients at Deloitte, I worked on a variety of projects. The subjects of these projects varied from cost takeouts to implementing automated error detection programs for hand-entered data. What almost all of these projects had in common was that I was the bridge between the technical and non-technical teams. As the 'interpreter', I worked to communicate what was useful from the business side to the technical team and/or execute those practical tasks myself.  I also was a key member of multiple firm strategic initiatives including creating a new offering based on text analytics and simulation based modeling.
Position-6-Description: As CEO/Founder of Tangible LLC, I was the product manager who charted the vision for new applications and hired developers. In particular, we created web applications that made yearbooks from social media profiles and, separately, helped skilled volunteers find their way to missions where they were needed.
Position-7-Description: As a data analyst, I improved on preexisting models for forecasting commodities markets and dramatically improved back-testing procedures.
Position-8-Description: As Assistant Campaign Manager for a nationally targeted challenger race, I held a number of roles. These roles ranged from helping to set district fund-raising record for our district to writing press releases that garnered substantial news coverage. I maintained the candidate's schedule, updated the campaign website/email list, and created targeting for all voter mobilization efforts in our 600,000 person district.

Title: Enterprise Data Strategy Director
Position-0-Description: As Enterprise Data Strategy Director,  I'm charged with setting a long-term program that will reshape the way AARP's many groups leverage and use business intelligence for the greater good of the organization. I'm accountable for setting clear communications across working groups, facilitating cross department projects, and delivering senior executive updates to define a multi-year road map that aligns with AARP's vision.  AARP is a nonprofit, nonpartisan organization, with a membership of more than 38 million, that helps people turn their goals and dreams into real possibilities, strengthens communities and fights for the issues that matter most to families such as healthcare, employment security and retirement planning. We advocate for consumers in the marketplace by selecting products and services of high quality and value to carry the AARP name as well as help our members obtain discounts on a wide range of products, travel, and services.
Position-1-Description: Supporting the launch of AARP Studios, a new communications division created to further the mission of AARP in the rapidly emerging media landscape. Bringing together the best of AARP's Social Communications and Broadcast teams. AARP Studios will fully integrate multi-media content production and social distribution to produce an enhanced experience across multiple channels and platforms. By focusing on audience first, the new team will develop an iterative storytelling approach to make sure the content resonates and serves the goals of the entire enterprise.
Position-2-Description: As the manager of the website analytics group at Navy Federal, I had the honor of serving our members by evolving a sophisticated solution using Adobe Analytics SiteCatalyst (Omniture). With our custom deployment, we analyze activity down to the individual member level. We use custom software and resources to ensure the security of members‚Äô personal and financial information adhering to all industry regulations and requirements. Our team provides support to the marketing, website, mobile, branch operations, contact center, and member research and intelligence departments with a focus on the members' experience. Since 1933, Navy Federal has grown from seven members to over 5 million members and $60 billion in assets and reserves. And since that time, its vision statement has remained focused on serving its unique field of membership. This includes Army, Marine Corps, Navy, Air Force, Coast Guard regular Active Duty and reservists, DoD, and Army and Air National Guard personnel.
Position-3-Description: As the Director of Online Marketing, I was responsible for managing all of Hinge's digital marketing strategies and services. These services include search engine optimization, website analytics, social media, paid search and media advertising, CRM and CMS, email lead generation as well as comprehensive web analytics. I worked closely with our content, creative and brand marketing groups to provide our clients with end to end marketing solutions. Hinge is a leading branding and marketing firm that specializes in the professional services. We regularly publish ground-breaking, original research that explores the marketing characteristics of high growth firms. Using this information, we help firms refocus, re-brand, launch new services, expand into new markets, and take their game to a higher level. Services include research, strategy, award-winning creative, and online marketing. We serve the architecture, engineering, construction, technology, government contracting, accounting, finance, and consulting industries.
Position-4-Description: I had a great time growing my DC area business relationships by serving as a NVTC.org member Vice-Chair of the Social Media Committee. As a 10+ year member, I welcome messages from anyone looking to get involved with NVTC. The Northern Virginia Technology Council (NVTC) is the membership association for the technology community in Northern Virginia. NVTC has about 1100 member companies representing more than 200,000 employees. Our membership includes companies from all sectors of the technology industry and the service providers that support these companies, as well as universities, foreign embassies, non-profit organizations and governmental agencies.  NVTC provides its members with: 1.Over 150 networking and educational events per year; 2.Comprehensive member benefit services; 3.Public policy advocacy on a broad range of technology issues at the state and regional levels, with involvement in federal issues as they relate to workforce and education concerns; 4.Community service opportunities through active involvement in community projects and philanthropy through the Equal Footing Foundation.

My areas of focus include Penton Marketing Services' social media marketing and and digital marketing strategies.  In this position, I enjoy evolving social media offerings while developing tactical strategies for internal and client specific new media programs.  Providing custom online marketing and social media programs for organizations that include Chevron, the American Cancer Society, DuPont and Rosetta Stone is an honor.  My social media strategies work in tandem with other online and off-line marketing tactics to drive measurable revenue and results. In March of 2011, Penton Media acquired EyeTraffic Media to become the cornerstone to its digital media services group.  Penton Media, Inc. is the largest independent business-to-business media company in the U.S., serving more than six million business professionals every month. The company's market-leading brands are focused on 30 industries and include 113 trade magazines, 145 Web sites, 96 industry trade shows and conferences, and more than 500 information data products.

Summary: The greatest compliment I've ever received is that I am a connector; I am truly passionate about connecting people, resources, and ideas on levels ranging from nano- to macro-scale.  After 10 years working at lab benches, I have zoomed out to work in the biomedical innovation and investment spaces, with the goals of educating all types of innovators, creating partnerships between academia and industry, and leveraging entrepreneurial energy into tangible, valuable outcomes. I created my online presence, The Sociable Scientist, to indulge my passion for involving non-scientists in conversations surrounding the latest and greatest research insights. I truly believe that the most impactful advances result from the engagement of diverse groups of people, and I want to empower and inform everyone.  My thesis research centered on the rational and creative design of biologically-inspired nanomaterials to redirect immune cells to ameliorate various disease states. Using fundamental engineering principles and immunological insights, we demonstrated efficacy in applications including vaccines, anti-parasitic therapies, genetic manipulation, and food allergy. Outside of the lab, I enjoy organizing and mobilizing people in the context of financial literacy, physical fitness, nutrition, and leadership development with the goal of helping myself and others achieve optimal health, productivity, and happiness. I am skilled at creating sustainable systems for long-term growth of individuals and communities. I am a voracious learner and my best self when coordinating interdisciplinary teams to complete complex and high-impact projects that will serve others.

Position-7-Description: My postdoctoral work was co-advised by Andre Levchenko, head of Yale's Systems Biology Institute and the John C. Malone Professor of Biomedical Engineering, and Ruslan Medzhitov, David W. Wallace Professor of Immunobiology and HHMI Investigator. One project focused on the role noise plays in transmitting information along immune cell interactions. Additionally, I collaborated with the Iwasaki Lab (Yale) to create mathematical models describing influenza infection. These models can be expanded to elucidate the transition of innate to adaptive immunity, effectively weighting the effects of components of the immune response and predicting viral spread.

Position-1-Title: Investment Manager, Private Equity | Established & grew private equity firm to $8M
Position-1-Description: My experience in private equity came to life in the hospitality industry. After connecting with an acquaintance in the property management space, I developed and executed business strategies, focused on acquiring and modernizing hotel properties to maximize revenue and profit growth. Over the course of 7 years, I acquired 5 properties, including well-known brands such as the Comfort Inn, Quality Inn, and Red Roof Inn, managed 6 Hotel Managers, and indirectly supervising between 20-40 staff across each site. ‚ñ∂Ô∏è HOW I USED DATA TO POWER BUSINESS I tapped into my programming and data science background to create predictive models that estimated ADR and revPAR rates, tracked hotel performance across occupancy levels, and yielded insights that significantly improved the customer experience. Using these insights, I coached Hotel Managers on how to use the modeling systems to measure growth and profitability, create performance improvement plans, and define and execute 3- and 5-year business plans in alignment with revenue objectives. Additionally, I worked with the Managers on initiating contact and partnerships with local businesses, including restaurants, shops, yoga studios, and sports arenas to create package plans that expanded market share. üìà Raised $8M in private equity funds to modernize hotel sites every 3-5 years üìà Drove a 50% EBITDA increase between the third and fourth year at each property In 2015, I was ready to pivot to a new field and play at another level‚Äîdentistry.
Position-2-Description: ‚ñ∂Ô∏è HOW I USED DATA TO POWER BUSINESS One of my major contributions was pioneering a model-based marketing system, combining Excel VBA, Access, and classification models, to strategically identify what, when, and where to market. This system delivered notable results and several success stories that varied from growing the patient base, reducing attrition rates, and building business value by honing in on target markets and accelerating YOY revenues. Here‚Äôs a few of my favorites: üìà Business Development | Grew Zivek to $30M in ad revenues A key factor in growing and scaling the business was creating and selling a series of business coaching plans, modules and comprehensive training systems to improve patient awareness, practice management, and conversion rates through analytics. üìà Revenue Management | Cut new patient acquisition costs 56% By creating patient profiles to target and narrow the base, our clients were able to understand their target market, including their interests, type of vehicle, and age of home, to personalize their marketing and weed out unlikely prospects. For example, one clinic optimized their conversion rates after the model revealed that patients living in newly renovated homes and/or households with 3+ bedrooms were more likely to pursue elective procedures. üìà Talent Development | Built and mentored an 8-member geographically-dispersed team I trained my team in best practices for optimizing practice dashboard analytics to convert data into meaningful visualizations, assess KPIs, and brainstorm new ways to achieve goals.
Position-3-Title: Data-Financial Analyst | Marketing Analyst | Online Performance Analyst
Position-3-Description: As an Online Performance Analyst and Data Scientist at REI, I applied my innate curiosity and knowledge of analytics and modeling to torture unknown (and unexpected) answers from large data sets. Merging my quantitative research, data analysis, and programming skills, I led the development and continuous improvement of data-driven solutions that identified core business drivers and maximized sales and marketing ROI across customer channels. ‚ñ∂Ô∏è HOW I USED DATA TO POWER BUSINESS I built multiple machine learning algorithms, using KNN, cluster customer analyses, and recommender system techniques to create 8 different customer profile types. These profiles ranged from weekend warriors and busy moms to active senior citizens. I trained these models to aggregate, filter, and extract data and display recommendations for specific retail items, upgrades, and add-ons, based on customer profile, effectively increasing average online order values. Additionally, the systems that I built were adopted for maximizing online sales, customer segmentation, and marketing strategies, specifically‚Äîboosting the open and read ratios for direct mail, email marketing, and social media channels. The machine learning and modeling skills that I acquired through my corporate finance and marketing experiences would go on to serve me well in my entrepreneurial endeavors as a Portfolio Manager for private equity and hedge fund assets.
Position-4-Title: Finance & Senior Marketing Analyst III | Drove marketing ROI through data analytics & models
Position-4-Description: I joined Microsoft in 2008, taking on a dual role as a Senior Marketing Analyst and Data Scientist. The financial modeling, machine learning, and quantitative analysis skills that I honed at Chase Bank supported me in researching, developing, testing, and evaluating different Microsoft AI scenarios, using ML models. These models were primarily used by Bing‚Äôs marketing teams to better understand (and predict) customer behavior, increase both reliability and relevance of search results, and drive increases in advertising revenues and conversion rates. ‚ñ∂Ô∏è HOW I USED DATA TO POWER BUSINESS I used a variety of ML models, including natural language processing, multi-modal representation, recommender systems, and predictive analytics, and created and trained several standard models to analyze large customer data sets. Through this information, I created and enhanced a predictive model that effectively quantified the buyer journey, from the initial research stage to the point of purchase. By analyzing and interpreting the model outputs, I prepared and presented a business case to our advertising partners, which revealed untapped revenue potential with 18% of customers who would convert early in the buying cycle. This case effectively persuaded Bing‚Äôs advertising partners to position their brand at the beginning of the buyer cycle for greater ROI, rather than waiting towards the end to bid on hyper-specific keyword searches, boosting click-thru rates and delivering: üìà Enhanced brand recognition with 6-7x more exposure in the buy cycle üìà Average 25% increase in advertiser spend for broader-based keywords üìà Observable 30% increase in the frequency of ad campaigns This approach catalyzed a shift in advertiser spend behavior, with a focus towards investing in longer-term campaigns and taking a more strategic marketing approach that began with the end result in mind.
Position-5-Title: Quantitative Modeler, Credit Risk | Built statistical machine learning models to evaluate risk
Position-5-Description: I began my corporate finance career as a Quantitative Modeler in the Credit Risk Office with JP Morgan Chase Bank. During this time, I worked with Relationship Managers, Loan Syndicates, Credit Risk Partners, and other senior stakeholders on developing risk management strategies in the credit and loan approval processes using models. ‚ñ∂Ô∏è HOW I USED DATA TO POWER BUSINESS My efforts were focused on developing, implementing, and continuously improving quantitative risk models for multiple lines of business throughout the bank. I built and ran multiple models, which evaluated probability of portfolio and loan-level default, exposure at default, and loss given defaults. By modeling extensive credit data and risk metrics, I was able to identify trends, potential red flags, and other early warning signs of overdue loans and covenant violations that supported senior management in credit risk decision-making processes.

Summary: Algorithms, Python, coffee, and whiteboards. I engineer intelligent systems. My years of experience in machine learning have taught me what works in the real world and what does not. This experience allows me to build, train, and lead machine learning teams that deliver results to my company's bottom-line. Complex problems are rarely solved with cookie-cutter solutions. More often than not, they require a rigorous deconstruction, a systematic planning, and a custom algorithm that is deployed as an API or data pipeline. This is where having boots-on-the-ground experience really counts. This is where I stand out. Currently, my team and I are engrossed in the quantum physics of online retail. The market data that we have access to is rivaled only by Amazon. We write computational APIs that predict the behavior of consumer markets, execute decisions on this knowledge, and learn automatically over time. For me, a good day is one where I have written more Python than English. I welcome opportunities to speak to students and to share my experience in the field of data science.
