Position-4-Description: Kojuba is a people analytics company that uses social network analysis to help leaders quantify and optimize their organization‚Äôs health in order to increase productivity, decrease turnover, and foster a culture of openness and learning.  Organizations have a formal structure and an informal structure. While the formal structure is defined by the company‚Äôs leadership, the informal structure naturally emerges as a result of daily interactions between people.  The formal structure is how relationships 'should' work and the informal structure is how they actually do. The informal structure and mechanics are almost always a mystery to organizational leaders.  This knowledge gap leads to poor decision-making that can breed misalignment, disengagement, and counter-productive behavior among employees. Kojuba provides a data-driven framework for leaders to identify and understand the internal social mechanics of their organization.  On the basis of quantitative findings, Kojuba provides customized recommendations for how organizations can bring their formal and the informal structures into harmony.  To find out more, please visit:   www.kojuba.com
Position-5-Description: Worked on-contract as a Sr. Data Scientist at Union Pacific Railroad (NYSE:UNP), a Fortune 500 company serving the Western two-thirds of the United States. In this role, I introduced new analytical methods for estimating the determinants of train-trip durations and origins of train fuel consumption. One of the biggest problems that the railroad faces is the problem of increased network congestion. I developed a new framework for mathematically modeling the railroad as a 'flow network.' This empowers the precise estimation of traffic, congestion, and rail-flow capacity at any location in the rail network and at any point in time. I delivered an interactive data visualization that pinpoints the geographic origins of unnecessary time-loss and fuel-loss. By implementing and maturing this framework, Union Pacific will more effectively predict and avert network congestion.

Freight estimation was previously conducted by human intuition.  The custom-engineered predictive model is expected to reduce the freight-estimation error by 40%, potentially saving the company several million dollars per year. Position-0-Description: I manage the Invention Science Fund (ISF) Incubator pipeline from idea to startup to exit. As part of this role, I take responsibility for all data across the organization and manage the data team in ensuring our Fund Leadership has the information they need to make decisions.  Being involved in both specific spinouts and managing the overarching pipeline as a whole, I have a thorough knowledge base of the elements that go into closing a deal, including tactical, strategic, financial, and legal considerations. I orchestrate timely closes and ensure all the relevant pieces are present and accounted for. ISF hasn‚Äôt always been the incubator powerhouse it is. When I was brought on at ISF, I helped drive the operational and strategic shift from license-based innovation to incubator-style innovation. As part of this shift, I co-implemented an innovative, custom Salesforce instance for tracking spin-outs from idea to post-exit. Implemented a cloud-based document management system and managed the migration of 1TB+ documents seamlessly across the organization. Created an innovative system and process for tracking asset encumbrance information. Finally, tying the whole ecosystem together with robust reporting and business intelligence capabilities for insightful Fund management. The Invention Science Fund (ISF) is rethinking, refining, and recreating the process of invention from idea to market. Established in 2003, ISF is an interdisciplinary team that includes 11 of top 50 American inventors. The team focuses on enabling breakthrough technologies to thrive globally‚Äîthrough Invention Sessions, licensing, joint ventures and startups‚Äîin areas such as metamaterials, biomedical technologies, energy, communications, the Internet of Things and more.
